intro: Hepetis megasepala, commonly known as the large-sepaled hephyra, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly bitter scent. Hepetis megasepala is often found in moist, open woods and thrives in partial shade.
